benchmark_details.name: ReSeDis (Referring Search and Discovery)
benchmark_details.overview: ReSeDis is a benchmark specifically designed to evaluate a modelâ€™s ability to perform large-scale referring object search in realistic, open-world settings, integrating large-scale image retrieval and fine-grained object localization.
benchmark_details.data_type: image with bounding boxes and segmentation masks

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the capability of models to search and localize objects in large image datasets based on natural language descriptions.

data.source: MS-COCO dataset with additional manual descriptions created for the benchmark.
data.annotation: Manually written referring expressions with bounding boxes and segmentation masks.

methodology.calculation: Recall accuracy is calculated based on the model's ability to correctly identify relevant images, while localization accuracy uses Precision at 50% overlap threshold (Pr@50).
methodology.interpretation: High recall accuracy indicates effective image searching, while high localization accuracy indicates precise object detection.
methodology.baseline_results: Top-1 image recall of 21.22% with YOLOv8 proposals; Top-1 image recall of 23.33% using ground-truth boxes.
